scenarioDescription:
The HD 183579 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 183579 is a star with 1.03 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.98 times its radius. It is located 186.77 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 2.6 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 183579 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 183579 system


HD 183579 b

HD 183579 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2021-01, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 183579 b is 19.710 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 183579 b is 3.550 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 183579 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 183579, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: HD 183579 - System With 1 Exoplanet
